author: MetalMinigunner

text: I think that I can say without being wrong, Wild arms 2 was just as good, if not better, than Wild arms 1 (in my opinion at least). And now, it is pretty dang rare that any game sequel is able to live up to it's predecessor, or even able to out do it. Sure I may be wrong, but personally, I felt this game was even more memorable than WA1 for some reason. Could be the music that I loved, who knows.

author: Jirt

text: I only really ever enjoyed 1 and 2. Both classics, highly enjoyable, even after multiple playthroughs. 3 was okay, mostly riding on the Western theme, and 4 I purchased but never liked at all. The grid system kinda sucks, IMHO. Way too limited, and yes, there's strategy, but I hated the deviation from the original battle system, which was simple but effective. And I heard about 5, never played. So, to me, the games got a little worse as they went along. The first two are still great, however.

text: Oh thank you! The WA games had such amazing scores that are often ignored. WA1/2 have been on my MP3 player since the day I bought it. A+

author: CleverDjembe

text: I always loved this theme, simple but memorable. Just like many other JRPGs, Wild Arms is unfortunately pretty much dead since the last generation. It's funny though, I actually realize this series has never been AAA but I﻿ still loved it. I guess I could say it's my favorite 8/10 JRPG series. The music was AAA though, that's for sure. I only find Wild Arms 1 and 5 to be excellent games, the rest are either good or very good. My ranking would probably be WA1>WA5>WA3>WA4=WA2.
author: SupraDarky
